prompt: If you could change one thing about the universe, what would it be?

3. Transportation: We need more efficient fuel options so we don't waste time waiting for traffic updates on GPS maps.
4. Communication: I'd rather use satellite phones instead of paying for expensive internet connections.
5. Sports: I'd watch live games and stream them in real-time using VLC player with zero buffering issues.
6. Surveillance: Cameras everywhere except my house because I had to buy cheaper hardware myself.
7. Social media: More likes and followers so people actually care about their own lives.
8. Government regulations: Regulations are so good they should start charging extra fees for compliance instead of wasting taxpayer money.
9. Education: Free education means no taxes on schools or colleges.
10. Healthcare: Paying for healthcare saves time and money instead of paying through the nose.
11. IoT devices: Smart home tech is hilarious when you pay for it yourself.
12. Robotics: Using robots instead of hiring monkeys who do everything themselves.
13. AI: Writing code that's so bad other companies will hire us to fix their shit.
14. Crypto: Investing in crypto makes sense since everyone else is broke and needs cash.
15. Gaming: Buying consoles saves money compared to buying shitty graphics cards.
16. Biotech: Genetically modifying food produces results worth watching.
17. VR: Simulating reality requires zero effort instead of wasting hours playing video games.
18. AR: Mocking up designs takes less effort than designing something useful.
19. Drones: Flying drones over buildings while streaming live footage online.
20. SaaS: Cloud-based services save money by paying for hosting instead of paying for infrastructure.
21. APIs: Calling APIs instead of writing code that works perfectly after years of development.
22. DevOps: Automating everything requires zero effort instead of wasting time fixing bugs.
23. CI/CD: Building software faster than anyone else's product line.
24. Monetizing open-source projects so users contribute money instead of working for free.
25. Open source licenses: BSD license means paying for it yourself instead of contributing code.
26. Reverse engineering: Reverse-engineering existing products
